description: Purchasing department procedures, Telnet navigation, item setup, allowances, and freight management

chunks.content: Warehouse codes: 01=Wayne, 02=NY (Amsterdam), 05=PA (Stroudsburg), 09=5th Street. Use these codes when entering POs or running reports.
PO Maintenance/Open PO screen: Menu 9 (Purchasing) > 21 (Purchase Orders on File). Enter warehouse number and your buyer or analyst number to view open POs.
PO confirmation rules: POs must be confirmed at least TWO DAYS prior to order hitting the building. ETA dates must be adjusted EVERY SINGLE DAY. PO discrepancies must be addressed immediately.
Lost Sales Report: Must be reviewed every morning by each analyst. Target fill rate is 99.5%. Report is generated and emailed from reports@driscollfoods.com each morning.

chunks.menu_path: 5-INVENTORY CONTROL / 15-STOCK STATUS MENU / 2-STOCK STATUS BY VENDOR
chunks.content: Print Stock Status by Vendor: Menu 5 > 15 > 2. Enter S=Short version, D=Day or S=Select vendor, enter day (M/T/W/R/F), buyer code, printer#, warehouse (01=Wayne), N=secondary vendors, Y=show other warehouse, N=flagged items (or Y to show lockouts/special orders/no inventory).

Enter Purchase Order: Menu 9 > 1. Enter operator# (first order only after login), vendor# (or A to lookup), Y/N for pickup. If pickup: M=Managed or B=Backhaul - for managed, enter pickup date then arrival date. Enter PO date (format: 011924), use arrows to select ETA based on lead time.

PO Entry warehouse/sending: Defaults to 01 (Wayne). Press F4 to change warehouse - enter 02 (Amsterdam) or 05 (Stroudsburg). Enter items and quantities, Y to print, E to email. Accept email/CC addresses, enter message with pertinent info, enter 1 to send. Confirmation email sent to you.
Wipeout Report: Notification sent to buyer when Sales keys out a larger than normal order. Address this IMMEDIATELY to prevent stock issues.
PO History Lookup: Menu 9 > 30. Enter PO# directly, or V + vendor number to search by vendor. Alternative: Go to vendor 28 screen, press H for full history.

School Vendor Projection Report: Menu 2 > 14 > 4. Enter next school day, then date 10 school days out (exclude weekends), buyer number, x3, printer#. Lists items by vendor for NYC Schools. ITALICIZED items = potential shorts within 10 days - focus on these. Options: place order, increase existing order, or move PO earlier. Note: email version loses italics formatting.
Intercompany Transfers: Enter in Menu 31 (Transfer Entry). Enter vendor number for the transfer type based on origin warehouse and temperature zone.
Amsterdam Internal Transfer vendor numbers: 222111=Dry, 222112=Cooler, 222113=Freezer. Use these when transferring FROM Amsterdam.
Wayne Internal Transfer vendor numbers: 898989=Dry, 899898=Cooler, 899999=Freezer. Use these when transferring FROM Wayne internally.

Inter-warehouse transfer vendor numbers: 104807=Wayne to NY (1-2), 111111=NY to Wayne (2-1), 666666=Wayne to PA (1-5), 555555=PA to Wayne (5-1), 104809=Wayne to 5th Street (1-9), 999111=5th Street to Wayne (9-1).

New Item Setup: Limit new items - all must be approved by manager. Salesman requests require DSM approval. Required specs: pack size, net & gross weight, case cube, manufacturer#, item#, UPC, TI HI, billing type, shelf life, guaranteed shelf life (what vendor guarantees customer receives). Contact vendor for specs.

Item Setup Process: Search for similar items to get sequential item number. Go to empty item screen, press F1, enter a number from similar items. Press A to begin entering. Field 2: Enter description with broader category first (e.g., 'CHIP POTATO BBQ' not 'BBQ POTATO CHIP', 'DRESSING ITALIAN HOMESTYLE' not 'HOMESTYLE ITALIAN DRESSING').

Item Setup key fields: Field 6 (Billing Type): 1=by case, 2=by weight (LB/OZ), 3=catchweight (variable weight like 4-7 LBs). Field 8 (Pieces per case): Enter split quantity or 1 if no split. Generally avoid splits except sturdy self-contained items (gallon jugs of mayo/oil OK, loose fry bags NO). Fields 10/11: Net/gross weight. Field 14: Case cube. Field 17: Landed cost.

Item Setup additional fields: Field 20: Unit type (bag/box/bottle) if applicable. Field 21: Manufacturer and item number. Field 22: Temperature zone. Field 23: Skip (F2). Field 27: TI/HI. Field 28: UPC. Field 32: Category number (? then spacebar to lookup). Field 37: Skip (F2). Field 38: Vendor number. Field 40: Alpha name (search term for sales reps). Field 41: Brand name.

Item Lockout codes (Field 43): X=Cannot key out until back in stock AND/OR on order (sales can key if on order based on ETA). Y=Locked to everyone, no keying unless inventory on hand. S=Locked out to BOE only. D=Locked out to street sales only.

Item special flags: Field 45 (Taxable): Food items=N, non-food items may be Y. Field 46 (DWO - Done When Out): Item will not be reordered, discontinued by Driscoll or manufacturer. Field 47 (Special Order): N=stocked item, Y=brought in for specific purpose/won't move (adds burden to item). Field 53 (Exclude Special): Y ensures special item mark won't fall off.

Close Code an Item: Menu 5 > 1 > Enter item#, Left arrow to movement screen, F8, enter salesman# or 6-digit customer#, Y to add. Can also close code to warehouse: C=Wayne, P=Stroudsburg, type DIV enter A enter=Amsterdam. Note: This is different from Field 43 lockout which prevents ALL salesmen from keying.
Category Burden Lookup: Menu 5 > 8. Press ? and dropdown will appear to find burden rate for specific category.

Sales Cost Calculator: Type 'SLSCOST' from home Telnet page. Enter landed cost (include freight), select category from dropdown, enter if special order (Y/N), enter if cost is by case or pound. Output: SLS cost (what reps mark up from) and MKT price (approx 7% margin target for reps to meet profit margins).

Unipro Foodservice: Driscoll Foods is member of Unipro, largest US foodservice cooperative with 850+ distributors/members. Allows smaller distributors to compete with national companies. Members pool purchases with Unipro suppliers who provide allowances and deals in return.

Unipro Allowances: UPA1 (Earned Distributor Allowance/EDA) - Each supplier has own EDA, percentage or dollar amount collected monthly on purchases. UPA2 (Supplier Pooled Allowance/SPA) - Periodic deals offered by Unipro throughout year. Unipro website has supplier info: payment terms, contacts, broker info, FOB locations, shipping minimums, Letters of Guarantee.

Add Vendor Allowances: In Purchase Order Menu, go to 28 (Vendor Master File Maintenance), select AL. First complete Header (H): Affect Totals (Y=deduct from invoice total, N=no effect), COG (Y=deduct from cost of goods/received cost, N=no effect), Total PO (0 for individual items, negative $ to apply to all items).

Item Allowances/Charges: Select C, enter 6-digit item#, choose #1 for allowance or #3 for charge. Select basis: Case price, Net weight, Catch weight, Percentage, or Gross weight. Select #2 to add allowance value or #4 for charge value. Allowance deducts from COG, Charge adds to COG. Up arrow then Y to finish. To apply to open PO, go into PO and enter through items.

Freight Fields usage: Freight Allowance 1 = Pickup with allowance that nets down on invoice. Freight Allowance 2 = Pickup allowance NOT netted on invoice (bill back). Freight Charge 1 = Pickup (no invoice effect) OR delivery freight that DOES affect PO. Freight Charge 2 = Delivery freight that does NOT affect invoice. Always review PO freight screen before confirming. Contact manager if uncertain.
Backhaul minimum: All backhauls must have minimum $200 of freight.
Straight Truck capacity: Max 12 pallets, max weight 2400 lbs, max cube 700.
Tractor Trailer (53') capacity: Max 24-25 pallets, max weight 42,500 lbs (dry) or 43,500 lbs (reefer), max cube 1400.

DOT Foods Schedule (cutoff is noon): Wayne - Monday for Friday delivery, Thursday for Wednesday delivery. NY - Monday for Friday delivery. PA - Thursday for Wednesday delivery. DOT website: https://www.dotfoods.com/shop/
